properties.abstract: If one hikes from Forcellina towards Piz Turba, it is like being in a moonscape. It is the result of the glacier’s disappearance from the north face. Traversing this moonscape is impressive and easy. The summit, too, is easy to climb. If you want a challenge, prolong the tour by climbing also Piz Forcellina. Even more demanding is the direct traverse from Piz Turba to Piz Forcellina by following the ridge.
properties.subtitle: On the way to the moon
properties.title: From Juf on the western ridge

sac_photos.title: The Turba range viewed from Avers; the ascent is first to Forcellina (left) and then to the summit (the unobtrusive peak to the right).
View from Piz Turba to Piz Duan

segments.description: From Juf take the mountain hiking trail towards Fuorcla da la Valletta. A few metres below the col a trail branches off to the right towards Forcellina. Ascend to Forcellina in a long traverse, with a few metres of descent in between.
segments.title: Juf - Forcellina

segments.description: At Forcellina leave the marked mountain hiking trail south-westward on glacier schrofen to reach the western ridge. Follow the ridge to the summit.
segments.title: Forcellina - Piz Turba

segments.description: Descend from Forcellina via Septimerpass to Bivio instead of returning to Juf: add 300 metres of vertical height down and 1 h. From Septimerpass you can descend to Casaccia (add 600 metres of vertical height down and 1½ h).
segments.title: Variant: descent to Bivio (or Casaccia)
